page.title: 07FARMING
page.content: Mortehoe consists of eleven farms namely Shaftsboro, Borough, Damage, Warcombe, Yarde, Easewell, North Morte, Town, Poole, Ossaborough and Willingcott. Ranging from an acreage of approximately sixty to two hundred and fifty, not one of these has a herd of dairy cows today. The last one of seventy cows was dispersed this year at Warcombe. The main source of income on farms today is sheep, beef, tourism and barley in that order. Machinery used for silage making and combining is mostly supplied by contractors from outside, for example forage harvester and combine. Ploughing, cultivating and planting is done by the farmer himself. Farmers today employ very few permanent workers.
